para: This initiative is taken by the team at IIT Roorkee striving to work towards the development of an e-reader on the Sundara-Kāṇḍa of Vālmīki-Rāmāyaṇam.

Vālmīki-Rāmāyaṇam is known as the Ādi-Kāvya (the first among great poems) and Vālmīki as the Ādi-Kavi. It consists of 24,000 verses and is divided into seven kāṇḍas, namely, Bāla-Kāṇḍa, Ayodhyā-Kāṇḍa, Araṇya-Kāṇḍa, Kiṣkindhā-Kāṇḍa, Sundara-Kāṇḍa, Yuddha-Kāṇḍa, Uttara-Kāṇḍa.

The present project deals with the Pañcama-Kāṇḍa known as the Sundara-Kāṇḍa. It comprises of 2857 verses in 68 sargas. This kāṇḍa is known not only for its exceptional literary merits, but also its narrative and spiritual excellence. It deals exclusively with the achievements of Hanuman ji in his search and discovery of Sitā-Mātā’s whereabouts. Vālmīki’s poetry is characterised throughout by sublimity, felicity and naturalness of expression with epic grandeur. Sundara-Kāṇḍa, besides marking the summit of his poetical excellence, is also a masterpiece of characterisation
